Exempt.definition: free or released from some obligation or duty to which others are subject
Exempt.origin: [certain properties are declared to be and cannot be taken by a person's creditors "J. H. Williamson"]

1.1: free or released from some obligation or duty to which others are subject

2.1: not subject or liable [certain properties are declared to be and cannot be taken by a person's creditors "J. H. Williamson"]

3.1: to release or exclude from some liability (as in taxation), obligation, or duty to which others are subject [
3.s: the income of a spendthrift trust "W. M. McGovern, Jr.
